definitions.title: Hiph.
definitions.body: shew willingness, be pleased, determine, undertake to do anything (and do it) (v. Ki Thes; Ar. wa0’ala is take refuge with, escape, hasten to a place; cf. II. [[אול]] be in front of, Nö:MBAK 1880. 775; Sab. [[ואל]] in n.pr. [[מואלת]] DHM:Epigr. Denkm. 53; perh. As âlû, accept, Lyon:Sargontexte 72)—

shew willingness to do anything, accept an invitation, acquiesce, sq. inf. [[וַי֫וֹאֶל משֶׁה לָשֶׁבֶת אֶת־הָאִישׁ]] Ex 2:21 (JE) and Moses was willing to dwell with the man (and did so), = Ju Jdg 17:11 (of Levite); elsewh. foll. by vb. fin.; [[וְלוּ הוֹאַלְנוּ וַנֵּשֶׁב]] Jos 7:7 and would that we had been willing and had stayed; esp. imv., sq. imv.: [[הוֹאֶל־נָא וְלִין]] Ju Jdg 19:6 be willing and spend the night (kindly accept my invitation) v. Ges:§ 110. 2 a, R 2; 120. 2 a, 2Ki 6:3 and (no [[וְ]]) 2Ki 5:23; [[הוֹאִילוּ פְַנוּ־בִי]] Job 6:28 i.e. be good enough to look upon me.

more actively, voluntarily undertake to do anything (and do it), sq. inf.: Ge 18:27 I have undertaken to speak = v:Ge 18:31 (both J); so 1Sa 17:39 MT, but rd. [[וַיֵּלֶא]], and he laboured vainly, for [[וַיׁאֶל]], so LXX, Gei:Urschrift, 377 We Dr (cf. also v:b [[לאׁ אוּכַל לָלֶכֶת בָּאֵלֶּה]]); sq. vb. fin. [[הוֹאִיל משֶׁה בֵּאֵר]] De 1:5 i.e. Moses took upon himself to expound the law.

more actively still, be pleased, determine on one's own responsibility, resolve, sq. inf.: Jos 17:12 (JE) = Ju Jdg 1:27 but the Canaanites were determined (shewed a determination) to remain in this territory (= persisted in dwelling there); Ju Jdg 1:35 the Amorites persisted in dwelling in Har-Ḥeres, etc.; sq. vb. fin., of irreligious action, [[הואיל הָלַךְ]] Ho 5:11 Ephraim persisted, he walked after vanity (rd. [[שׁוא]] for [[חו]], v. Che); elsewh. only of the divine good pleasure: sq. inf. 1Sa 12:22 ´[[י]] hath been pleased to make you a people for himself; 1Ch 17:27; sq. vb. fin. [[הוֹאֵל וּבָרֵךְ]] 2Sa 7:29 be pleased and bless the house of thy servant; [[וְיׁאֵל אֱלוֹהַּ]] [[וִידַכְּאֵנִי]] Job 6:9 and that Eloah would be pleased and crush me! (v. Ges:§ 120, 2 a Da:Synt. § 83 b).
